titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 682: Meditationes in duodecim primos psalmos Davidis prophetae in honorem 12 apostolorum

notesStmt.note: Incipit: Amantissime domine deus, unica spes animae meae ... (f. 2r)

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Meditations with 14 engravings of the apostles by Adrian Collaert. Also includes one figurated and several smaller illuminated initials of the late 14th or early 15th century pasted in.

msItem.title: Meditationes in duodecim primos psalmos Davidis prophetae in honorem 12 apostolorum

supportDesc.extent: 73 leaves : 130 x 94 (91 x 68) mm. bound to 137 x 95 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 73; [i, 1-68, iv]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 21-22 long lines; frame-ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Includes 14 engravings by Adrian Collaert depicting standing figures of the apostles, with miniature scenes of their deaths or martyrdoms in the background; plus one pasted-in historiated initial in gold, blue, red, pink, green, and black depicting St. Gertrude of Nivelles in a nun's habit holding a book and crozier with four rats (f. 2r); and other pasted-in illuminated initials at the beginnings of the psalms (f. 7r, 11v, 17r, 22v, 27r, 32r, 38v, 43r, 48r, 54r, 58r, and 63r).
Historiated initial, Initial A, St. Gertrude with rats, f. 2r
Engraving, St. James the Greater, f. 15r
Engraving, St. James the Lesser, f. 47r

binding.p: Contemporary stamped vellum, repaired on the front hinge, with leather ties. Moderate oxidation of the ink; paper is brown, dry, and crumbling at the edges.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by E. B. Krumbhaar, 1910.
